text:
//? z.
May 11, 1961
Mr. Elmer G. Sulaer, Director
Radio and Television Communications
Station WFI0 (JM)
Indiana University
Bloomington, Indiana
Dear Bromot
I certainly agree that nothing definitive happened at,JR
consult tee meeting in Columbus. ..and it was disappointing.
The only other thing I can think of to add to the minutes
ist Didn’t that group agree that it was not wise to try the
decals?
I also agree with you that the committee members may he
somewhat disappointing—except that I think Tom Petry has
some pretty good ideas...but the committee conversation
somehow never seemed to get to the point where he could
advance any of them. As I recall, he made one feeble
attempt to try to answer Harold's question of what the
committee would recommend if it had $1,000 to spend next
year. Maybe be can do better by letter...and perhaps the
absent members would have some ideas, if asked that question,
too.
It was good to see you and your wife again, anyway. And I
wonder whether you went home via the antique shops or the
railroad yards.
Best regards,
(Mrs.) Betty Mtftenaie
Publications Editor
BMC/dp
ccs Harold E. Hill
